forecast.name: Today
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers between noon and 5pm. Mostly cloudy. High near 74, with temperatures falling to around 67 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 7 to 13 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers before 9pm, then rain showers likely and patchy fog. Cloudy, with a low around 50. East wind 5 to 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The day unfolds in Boston beneath a shroud of clouds, creating an atmosphere that feels both contemplative and softly dreary. With the time nearing midday, a chance of rain showers lingers in the air, promising a brief interlude of dampness between noon and five. The high temperature, a modest 74 degrees, will float down to around 67, echoing the cool breath of spring just as it begins to yield to the warmth of summer. A gentle southwestern wind whispers through the leaves, though the overarching gloom of clouds might cast a veil over your spirit.

As twilight approaches, expect the rain to intensify, accompanied by the onset of patchy fog weaving its way into the evening. The temperatures will drop further to a cool 50, inviting you to layer up for the night ahead. A light jacket or sweater should suffice to ward off the chill while wandering through the quiet streets, perhaps discovering a favorite café or tucked-away bookshop where the soft sounds of rain can accompany your thoughts. The forecast may hint at a changeable day, but with a little creativity, the evening presents an opportunity to embrace the tranquility that a rainy spring night brings.
